title: A Collaborative Jade Recognition System for Mobile Devices Based on Lightweight and Large Models
author: Zhenyu Wang (North China Electric Power University), Wenjia Li (North China Electric Power University), Pengyu Zhu (North China Electric Power University), ..., Zhenyu Wang (North China Electric Power University)
relevance_why: The paper discusses a collaborative recognition system that could inform similar approaches in audio data processing where lightweight and complex models work together for efficient real-time performance.
background: Developing a mobile system that can efficiently recognize jade artifacts by using a combination of lightweight and large models to manage limited processing resources on mobile devices.
contribution: This paper introduces a hybrid recognition system to solve challenges in mobile jade identification, achieving high accuracy while managing resource constraints effectively.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing jade recognition systems often struggle with real-time processing on mobile devices due to high computational demands.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work proposes a collaborative architecture that splits processing tasks between a lightweight model on the mobile device and a heavier model on a cloud server, enhancing efficiency and accuracy.

key_innovation: The unique aspect of the method lies in its dual-model architecture, which allows for preliminary screening on mobile devices and detailed analysis on a cloud server, providing a balanced approach to resource management.
real_world_impact: The proposed system has the potential to greatly ease the appraisal and verification of jade artifacts in mobile settings, benefiting both collectors and professionals in cultural heritage sectors.
limitations: No limitations explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.depthwise separable convolutions: **Depthwise separable convolutions** are a type of convolutional neural network layer that splits the filtering process into two parts: depthwise filtering and pointwise filtering, significantly reducing the model's computational burden.
new_terms.multi-scale feature learning: **Multi-scale feature learning** is an approach in which multiple resolutions of an image are analyzed to capture varying details, enhancing the model's ability to understand complex features.
